title: Salmon
description: Salmon is a popular food. Classified as an oily fish, salmon is considered to be healthy due to the fish's high protein, high omega-3 fatty acids, and high vitamin D content.
products: Salmon fillets (4) 1/2 teaspoon salt 1/2 teaspoon pepper 1 tablespoon lemon juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Season salmon fillets with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Place in a baking dish and bake for 12-15 minutes.

title: Salmon with Tomatoes and Greens
description: Salmon baked with tomatoes and greens, a dish rich in protein, carbohydrates, fiber, vitamins, minerals, and healthy fats.
products: 4 salmon fillets, 2 tomatoes or cherry tomatoes, 1 bunch cilantro, 4 cloves garlic, 1 lemon, 1 teaspoon paprika, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon Atlantic salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Preheat oven to 220 degrees C (turbo).
Chop all vegetables (peel and deseed the lemon) and crush the garlic.
Add spices gently and mix everything with hands, slightly crushing the mixture to release juices and flavors.
Generously place the mixture on the fish (cut large pieces and season between them).
About 10-15 minutes before eating, place on the top shelf of the oven. Bake for 10-15 minutes until the fish is medium rare.
Serve with lemon, alongside white rice or any other natural carbohydrate.

title: Chicken Thighs with Crispy Rice
description: Chicken thighs or parts cooked with crispy rice on the stovetop.
products: 4 chicken thighs, 2 white onions, 2 celery stalks, 1 cup white rice, 1 teaspoon baharat, 1 teaspoon paprika, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon Atlantic salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Slice the onions thinly and fry until nicely browned.
Add chicken parts, spices (generously with paprika and baharat) and continue cooking (can use a covered pot and stir occasionally).
When the chicken gets a nice color, add rice and stir for another 5 minutes with the pot covered.
Place whole celery leaves in the pot for umami flavor, add water and salt (1.5 cups of water and 1 teaspoon of salt per cup of rice).
Cook on very low heat for about 1.5 hours.
Before serving, increase the heat to give the rice at the bottom a good crisp.
Serve alongside a salad with vegetables and greens.

title: Greens and Chestnuts Salad
description: A fresh and vibrant salad with greens, chestnuts, and a tangy dressing.
products: 1 head lettuce, 1 bunch spinach or watercress, 2 green onions, 1 zucchini, 1 cup chestnuts, 1 teaspoon honey, 1 lemon, 1 orange, 1 teaspoon crushed chili, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon Atlantic salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Wash and tear the leaves by hand, slice the zucchini thinly with a peeler, halve the chestnuts and mix everything in a bowl.
In a jar, squeeze lemon juice, orange juice, add a teaspoon of honey, crushed chili to taste, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Pour the dressing over the salad just before serving and toss gently to maintain crispness.
Serve alongside meat, fish, chicken, or even homemade hummus.

title: Chickpea Tortillas
description: Simple and nutritious tortillas made from chickpea flour, perfect with various fillings.
products: 1 cup chickpea flour, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric (optional), 1/2 teaspoon salt
instructions: In a bowl, mix chickpea flour with water to a pancake batter consistency.
Add turmeric and salt to taste.
Heat a non-stick pan with a little olive oil. When the oil is hot (not burning), pour in the batter.
Flip only after bubbles appear and the edges are slightly brown.
Remove when the center of the tortilla is dry.
Serve with scrambled eggs, avocado, and a simple vegetable salad.

title: Homemade Hummus
description: Creamy and delicious homemade hummus, perfect as a dip or spread.
products: 2 cups frozen chickpeas, 2 celery stalks, 1 white onion, 1/2 cup full tahini, 1 lemon, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon Atlantic salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: In a pot with boiling water, add quartered onion, whole celery leaves, and salt. Cook until chickpeas are soft.
Remove the onion and celery, and 3/4 of the water.
Transfer the remaining chickpeas and 1/4 of the water to a food processor. Add tahini and blend until smooth.
For extra smoothness, pass the hummus through a sieve.
Serve with olive oil, lemon, chopped parsley and cilantro, alongside hard-boiled eggs or any leftover protein.

title: Coarse Vegetable Salad
description: A robust salad with fresh vegetables, seasoned simply and deliciously.
products: 2 cucumbers, 2 tomatoes, 1 red onion, 2 green onions, 1 teaspoon za'atar, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon Atlantic salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Cut all vegetables into coarse strips.
Generously season with olive oil, za'atar, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
Serve as a side dish to the main meal.

title: Chicken, Chickpea, and Vegetable Stew
description: A hearty stew with chicken, chickpeas, and a variety of vegetables.
products: 4 chicken thighs, 1 white onion, 1 cup fresh or frozen chickpeas, 2 celery stalks, 1 bunch parsley, 1 bunch cilantro, 1 teaspoon turmeric, 1 teaspoon paprika, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon Atlantic salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: In a pot, heat olive oil and add diced or sliced onion until golden.
Add chicken parts, turmeric, and paprika, and continue to cook until lightly browned.
Add chickpeas, chopped celery, parsley, and cilantro, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour boiling water until the chicken starts to float, season with salt and pepper, and cook on low heat for 2-3 hours.
Serve with white rice, mashed potatoes, or crispy baked sweet potatoes.

title: Meat and Bone Casserole
description: A rich casserole of assorted meats and bones, slow-cooked with vegetables and spices.
products: 2 lbs beef ribs, 2 osso buco pieces, 1 lb shoulder meat, 1 celery root, 2 parsley roots, 2 cilantro roots, 4 carrots, 2 white onions, 2 celery stalks, 1 teaspoon cocoa, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 tablespoon silan, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon Atlantic salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees C.
Place meats on a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roughly chop the roots, onions, carrots, and celery, and spread among and over the meat.
Prepare a mixture in a cup of boiling water with cocoa, add spices generously, and pour over the meat and vegetables.
The water should reach halfway up the baking sheet. Drizzle silan over everything.
Bake at high heat for 20 minutes, then reduce to 160-170 degrees C and cook for 4 hours.
Serve with white rice, mashed potatoes, or roasted butternut squash.
